match.title: 1st Match
match.statusText: West Indies won by 6 wickets (with 73 balls remaining)

dismissalText.commentary: Angelo Mathews not out 55 (77b 5x4 0x6 118m) SR: 71.42

headshotImage.caption: Sunil Narine player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Sunil Narine player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mahela Jayawardene c Ramdin b Narine 52 (52b 7x4 0x6 86m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: given right away, Mahela turns back immediately as well, Narine strikes in his first over, tossed up offspinner, Mahela hesitantly forward to try and defend, inside edge, onto pad, and pops up for Ramdin to take a dolly, what a huge strike, he was purring along, Mahela

headshotImage.caption: Sunil Narine player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Sunil Narine player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: given right away, Mahela turns back immediately as well, Narine strikes in his first over, tossed up offspinner, Mahela hesitantly forward to try and defend, inside edge, onto pad, and pops up for Ramdin to take a dolly, what a huge strike, he was purring along, Mahela
Narine has removed the big guns, Sanga has loosely pushed this flighted delivery straight to extra cover, just pushed firmly at it from the crease without leaning out
Narine takes another one, Mendis hits the sweep hard against the turn, but also in the air, and straight to deep square leg
the other one follows from Narine, pitches leg, spins away and hits Malinga plumb in front, didn't look as plumb on replays, lots of bounce, but ball tracker has it clipping top of off

headshotImage.caption: Ravi Rampaul player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ravi Rampaul player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: and Thirimanne picks out the man in the deep, makes room outside leg, gets under a full delivery - an offcutter - and lofts it high and straight to long off

Pollard takes the top edge on the deep square leg boundary, Kula leans back and goes for the pull to a bouncer dug into him, Pollard runs to his right and settles under it, takes it with the top of his fingers, but safely in the end
another one down, Herath swings a good length delivery tamely to mid off

headshotImage.caption: Dwayne Bravo player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dwayne Bravo player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Upul Tharanga c Ramdin b DJ Bravo 25 (43b 3x4 0x6 56m) SR: 58.13

dismissalComment.html: there comes the first wicket! It was a short of length delivery angling across the left hander, Tharanga chooses to throw his bat at that without moving his feet and pays the price as he gets a feather on that one. It settles in keeper's gloves at a nice comfortable height

dismissalText.commentary: Dinesh Chandimal c DJ Bravo b Samuels 21 (37b 1x4 1x6 49m) SR: 56.75

dismissalComment.html: they are falling, softly but surely, now Chandimal picks out midwicket, leaning out and casually turning a full offbreak to the fielder

dismissalText.commentary: Ajantha Mendis c Charles b DJ Bravo 2 (5b 0x4 0x6 5m) SR: 40

dismissalComment.html: and this time he's steered it straight to that man, Bravo digging it short from round the stumps, and Ajantha precision-guided it to wide slip

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Chris Gayle c Chandimal b BAW Mendis 109 (100b 9x4 7x6 129m) SR: 109

dismissalComment.html: Gayle departs finally, tried to slog-sweep a tossed up ball out of sight, Chandimal judges the steepling top edge and takes it at forward square leg

headshotImage.caption: Johnson Charles player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Johnson Charles player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Johnson Charles player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Johnson Charles player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Johnson Charles c Jayawardene b Herath 29 (58b 1x4 2x6 83m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: Charles ends on a strike-rate of 50, Herath switches over the stumps and tosses it up around leg, Charles makes room and gets on the knee for a slog, and Mahela makes no mistake, running in from long on to take the top edge

headshotImage.caption: Kieron Pollard player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kieron Pollard player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Kula's got an lbw appeal ruled in his favour, far closer ones have been turned down today, the tall Pollard was on the walk, and was hit above the knee roll, he cannot believe it, replays show Pollard was also struck outside the line of off, what a howling howler from Pollard's fellow Trinidadian Joel Wilson

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Gayle departs finally, tried to slog-sweep a tossed up ball out of sight, Chandimal judges the steepling top edge and takes it at forward square leg

dismissalText.commentary: Darren Bravo run out (Malinga/Kulasekara) 27 (30b 4x4 0x6 48m) SR: 90

dismissalComment.html: what a way to go, Bravo was racing for the single as Samuels drove to mid on, Malinga got rid of the ball quickly, and Kula whipped the bails off, Bravo was stranded mid sea

headshotImage.caption: Kieron Pollard player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kieron Pollard player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Kieron Pollard player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kieron Pollard player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Kieron Pollard lbw b Kulasekara 0 (4b 0x4 0x6 7m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: Kula's got an lbw appeal ruled in his favour, far closer ones have been turned down today, the tall Pollard was on the walk, and was hit above the knee roll, he cannot believe it, replays show Pollard was also struck outside the line of off, what a howling howler from Pollard's fellow Trinidadian Joel Wilson

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

headshotImage.caption: Sunil Narine player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Sunil Narine player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Ravi Rampaul player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ravi Rampaul player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: Samuels skips out and lashes it straight back to the bowler, who tries to help it onto the non-striker's stumps and misses, that will do it

commentPostTextItems.html: That is it from this game. Abhishek Purohit signing off. Cheers

Gayle is the Man of the Match. Gayle: "Been a while having got a century, really good to get it in front of the home crowd. We restricted them well on a good batting wicket, we utilised the conditions well in the morning.. The opening partnership was vital. Coming from England and getting a century was a good thing for me. I am home, you know the conditions well."

Dwayne Bravo: "Winning the first game is always important. Was important to rotate the bowlers on a flat wicket. We kept taking wickets and stifling their innings. Narine is our mystery bowler, happy to have him. In the 29th over, we sent a message to Chris to try and win it with a bonus point."

Mathews: "Important toss, it was two paced, holding up a bit, it got easier, but a special hundred by a special person. We had to adapt to the wicket but we lost wickets and could not get going, Mahela batted brilliantly but he had no partners. We thought we had  a chance, the wicket was two paced but it flattened out. When Gayle gets going, no attack is enough and no ground big enough."

West Indies pocket a bonus point for ending the chase inside 40 overs. Gayle blasted an entertaining hundred at his home ground, but 208 was not a competitive total on this pitch. All-round lack of bite from Sri Lanka today, with bat, ball and on the field

commentTextItems.html: flighted ball defended behind point
looked to jump out, stayed back and steered to backward point
presses forward to defend a tossed up ball outside off stump
Samuels dances out again and connects this time against Mendis, carting against the turn just over the deep midwicket rope
backs away outside leg late and punches hard but straight to extra cover

headshotImage.caption: Dwayne Bravo player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dwayne Bravo player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: leans forward to work it to midwicket
nice, tossed up, on leg stump, and turns past the outside edge
worked to midwicket
outside leg stump from over the wicket, and Bravo drills a powerful sweep past short fine leg
tossed up, pushed back to the bowler
hit on the pad as he leaves the crease

headshotImage.caption: Dwayne Bravo player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dwayne Bravo player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: misses the cut as this one skids on low outside off
comes down, is beaten by a straighter one, it pops up in the air, Mendis goes for it with a dive, could have been an inside edge
flatter one, pushed back to the bowler
tosses it up, Samuels comes out and drives but cannot beat extra cover

commentPreTextItems.html: batting Powerplay time, and Jeevan Mendis comes on

Jordan: "I think West Indies are once again proving that once Gayle has gone there isn't much left. If the Windies want to become the team of the past they really need to become a team rather than a 1 man band"

commentTextItems.html: turned to square leg off the pad
defended off the front foot

headshotImage.caption: Dwayne Bravo player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dwayne Bravo player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: Bravo moves forward, plays that wristy flick over midwicket and picks up four
lunges forward and defends a bouncing delivery

dismissalComment.html: there comes the first wicket! It was a short of length delivery angling across the left hander, Tharanga chooses to throw his bat at that without moving his feet and pays the price as he gets a feather on that one. It settles in keeper's gloves at a nice comfortable height

headshotImage.caption: Sunil Narine player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Sunil Narine player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mahela Jayawardene c Ramdin b Narine 52 (52b 7x4 0x6 86m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: given right away, Mahela turns back immediately as well, Narine strikes in his first over, tossed up offspinner, Mahela hesitantly forward to try and defend, inside edge, onto pad, and pops up for Ramdin to take a dolly, what a huge strike, he was purring along, Mahela

headshotImage.caption: Sunil Narine player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Sunil Narine player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Kieron Pollard player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kieron Pollard player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Kumar Sangakkara c Pollard b Narine 17 (23b 1x4 0x6 42m) SR: 73.91

dismissalComment.html: Narine has removed the big guns, Sanga has loosely pushed this flighted delivery straight to extra cover, just pushed firmly at it from the crease without leaning out

headshotImage.caption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Dwayne Bravo player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dwayne Bravo player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Dinesh Chandimal c DJ Bravo b Samuels 21 (37b 1x4 1x6 49m) SR: 56.75

dismissalComment.html: they are falling, softly but surely, now Chandimal picks out midwicket, leaning out and casually turning a full offbreak to the fielder

headshotImage.caption: Ravi Rampaul player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ravi Rampaul player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Johnson Charles player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Johnson Charles player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Lahiru Thirimanne c Charles b Rampaul 6 (19b 1x4 0x6 20m) SR: 31.57

dismissalComment.html: and Thirimanne picks out the man in the deep, makes room outside leg, gets under a full delivery - an offcutter - and lofts it high and straight to long off

headshotImage.caption: Ravi Rampaul player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ravi Rampaul player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Kieron Pollard player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kieron Pollard player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Nuwan Kulasekara c Pollard b Rampaul 2 (6b 0x4 0x6 8m) SR: 33.33

dismissalComment.html: Pollard takes the top edge on the deep square leg boundary, Kula leans back and goes for the pull to a bouncer dug into him, Pollard runs to his right and settles under it, takes it with the top of his fingers, but safely in the end

headshotImage.caption: Sunil Narine player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Sunil Narine player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Jeevan Mendis c Samuels b Narine 5 (12b 0x4 0x6 18m) SR: 41.66

dismissalComment.html: Narine takes another one, Mendis hits the sweep hard against the turn, but also in the air, and straight to deep square leg

headshotImage.caption: Ravi Rampaul player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ravi Rampaul player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Rangana Herath c Sammy b Rampaul 4 (8b 0x4 0x6 11m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: another one down, Herath swings a good length delivery tamely to mid off

headshotImage.caption: Sunil Narine player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Sunil Narine player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Lasith Malinga lbw b Narine 8 (9b 0x4 1x6 14m) SR: 88.88

dismissalComment.html: the other one follows from Narine, pitches leg, spins away and hits Malinga plumb in front, didn't look as plumb on replays, lots of bounce, but ball tracker has it clipping top of off

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Dwayne Bravo player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dwayne Bravo player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Johnson Charles player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Johnson Charles player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Ajantha Mendis c Charles b DJ Bravo 2 (5b 0x4 0x6 5m) SR: 40

dismissalComment.html: and this time he's steered it straight to that man, Bravo digging it short from round the stumps, and Ajantha precision-guided it to wide slip

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Chris Gayle c Chandimal b BAW Mendis 109 (100b 9x4 7x6 129m) SR: 109

dismissalComment.html: Gayle departs finally, tried to slog-sweep a tossed up ball out of sight, Chandimal judges the steepling top edge and takes it at forward square leg

headshotImage.caption: Johnson Charles player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Johnson Charles player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Johnson Charles player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Johnson Charles player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Johnson Charles c Jayawardene b Herath 29 (58b 1x4 2x6 83m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: Charles ends on a strike-rate of 50, Herath switches over the stumps and tosses it up around leg, Charles makes room and gets on the knee for a slog, and Mahela makes no mistake, running in from long on to take the top edge

dismissalText.commentary: Darren Bravo run out (Malinga/Kulasekara) 27 (30b 4x4 0x6 48m) SR: 90

dismissalComment.html: what a way to go, Bravo was racing for the single as Samuels drove to mid on, Malinga got rid of the ball quickly, and Kula whipped the bails off, Bravo was stranded mid sea

dismissalText.commentary: Marlon Samuels not out 15 (24b 1x4 1x6 25m) SR: 62.5

headshotImage.caption: Kieron Pollard player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kieron Pollard player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Kieron Pollard player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kieron Pollard player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Kieron Pollard lbw b Kulasekara 0 (4b 0x4 0x6 7m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: Kula's got an lbw appeal ruled in his favour, far closer ones have been turned down today, the tall Pollard was on the walk, and was hit above the knee roll, he cannot believe it, replays show Pollard was also struck outside the line of off, what a howling howler from Pollard's fellow Trinidadian Joel Wilson

headshotImage.caption: Dwayne Bravo player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dwayne Bravo player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Dwayne Bravo not out 8 (11b 2x4 0x6 13m) SR: 72.72

milestones.description: Chris Gayle has scored 65 fifty-plus scores in ODIs, the most for WI breaking Brian Lara's record
Sangakkara has scored 87 fifty-plus scores in ODIs, the most for SL breaking Jayasuriya's record

seriesStandings.notes:
21.9 Points 21.9.1 Preliminary Matches In a competition with three or four Members with ODI status and with a final match or series, the home Board will institute a points system as follows: Win, with bonus point - 5
Win, without bonus point - 4
Tie or No Result - 2
Loss - 0 In the event of teams finishing on equal points, the right to play in the final match or series will be determined as follows:
  • The team with the most number of wins
  • If still equal, the team with the most number of wins over the other team(s) who are equal on points and have the same number of wins
  • If still equal, the team with the highest number of bonus points
  • If still equal, the team with the highest net run rate
In a match declared as no result, run rate is not applicable. 21.9.2 Net Run Rate A team's net run rate is calculated by deducting from the average runs per over scored by that team throughout the competition, the average runs per over scored against that team throughout the competition. In the event of a team being all out in less than its full quota of overs, the calculation of its net run rate shall be based on the full quota of overs to which it would have been entitled and not on the number of overs in which the team was dismissed. Only those matches where results are achieved will count for the purpose of net run rate calculations. Where a match is abandoned, but a result is achieved under Duckworth/Lewis, for net run rate purposes Team 1 will be accredited with Team 2's Par Score on abandonment off the same number of overs faced by Team 2. Where a match is concluded but with Duckworth/Lewis having been applied at an earlier point in the match, Team 1 will be accredited with 1 run less than the final Target Score for Team 2 off the total number of overs allocated to Team 2 to reach the target. 21.9.3 Bonus Points The team that achieves a run rate of 1.25 times that of the opposition shall be awarded one bonus point. A team's run rate will be calculated by reference to the runs scored in an innings divided by the number of overs faced. Refer Appendix 6. 21.9.4 Final Match or Series If no result is achieved in a final the match shall be declared drawn. In the event of a drawn final, the prize money will be shared equally between the two competing teams.
